title: MA586 - Stochastic Methods for Algorithms
my_thoughts: (In-Progress) MA586 has been a writing-intensive proof-heavy journey into stochastic data science algorithms. My LaTeX skills have never been pushed harder.

title: CS350 - Distributed Systems
my_thoughts: (In-Progress) Queue management, concurrency control, system performance analysis, and all of it in C... What more could one want?

title: CS541 - Applied Machine Learning
my_thoughts: (In-Progress) Project-based exploration of various ML algorithms. Never thought I'd know as much about the iris dataset as I do now.

title: LG463 - German Theatre
my_thoughts: (In-Progress) So far Biedermann und die Brandstifter (The Fireflies) has given me a masterclass in the fine art of denial; no wonder Frisch called it a "moral-less fable."

title: MA294 - Applied Abstract Algebra
my_thoughts: Let me know if anyone needs to figure out how many unique ways (not counting redudant configurations) there are to arrange 3 green beads and 5 blue beads on a circular necklace.

title: MA570 - Stochastic Methods for OR
my_thoughts: Queuing theory and continuous time Markov chains!

title: LG350 - Introduction to German Literature
my_thoughts: Hard to pinpoint just a few texts to shoutout from this class. I really loved Die Leiden des jungen Werthers and Der Goldne Topf (the latter of which might be the craziest story I've ever read).

title: CS210 - Computer Systems
my_thoughts: First time using Linux, C, and x86 Assembly. Two were much more enjoyable than the other *cough* Assembly *cough*.
